page.title: 03A DOCTORS DAY IN 1985
page.content: In the morning the doctor holds consultations with patients at the surgery.The most common illnesses are colds, chest and throat infections, virus diseases and bacterial diseases (tonsilitis,laryngitis). Also bone and joint diseases ,rheumatism, arthritis, slipped discs. Some patients are referred to the local hospital for second opinions or for x-rays and blood tests. After surgery the doctor continues with home and hospital visiting. Some of these patients are seriously ill or elderly and the doctor sometimes has to attend accidents. Much of the doctors work is of a preventive nature e.g. innoculation of babies against whooping cough, diptheria, measles and poliomyelitis. The doctors bag contains a stethoscope,syringes,drugs etc.
